title: I've been really busy
body: I know... I know. I promised new phlogs, and I've yet to deliver. I have FOUR (count them, FOUR) new phlogs loaded and ready to go. All they're waiting on are a few witty captions. Actually, I can't promise they'll be witty, but I'll try. You know how it goes. I've been working 80 hour weeks for the last month, which is why I haven't been posting as much as usual. I hope you'll forgive me and stay tuned for some seriously kick ass phlogs TOMORROW (night, most likely). I tell you, the worst thing about doing EVERYTHING on your own is that you can't do stuff simultaneously. If we had all the money in the world, I'd have the painters working along side the floor refinishers working along side the trim guys working along side the projector installers, etcetera ad infinitum. Unfortunately, we have to do everything step by step by step... Step by step, Day by day, A new something something, A different hand to play. The people we meet, The places we something. We'll make it better, The next time around. More tomorrow. Word to your mother!
author: Dan

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body: You could probably post a picture of a paintbrush and we would be oohing and ahhing over it. I hope I speak for us all when I say the less time spent blogging on here (as much as we love it) and more time spent polishing up the Moxie is all good. Can't wait for opening night! Is Sept. 2 still a possibility or do you think you might have to push it back a week or two?

comments.author: erin
comments.body:
The dream, wide broken seemed like all was lost.
What would be the future?  Could you pay the cost?
You wonder, will there ever be a second time around?

Woah-a, woah-a
When the tears are over and the moment has come
Say "My lord, I think I found someone."
And no one would be better to be putting it together for the second time around.

We got the woman and man.  We got the kids in a clan.
Only time will tell if all these dreams fit under one umbrella.

Step by step.  Day by day.
A fresh start over.  A different hand to play.
The deeper we fall, the stronger we stay
And we'll be better the second time around.

Step by step.  Day by day (Day by day)
A fresh start over a different hand to play.
Only time will tell but you know what they say
We'll make it better the second time around


: )
